summary: A detailed victim statement from a sex trafficking survivor of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, dated August 19, 2022. The statement primarily accuses her former legal representatives (attorneys Stan Pottinger, Sigrid McCawley, and their firm) of betrayal, conflicts of interest, failing to protect her, and obstructing justice. It describes her abuse, attempts to seek justice, and her lawyers' alleged collusion with or negligence towards Epstein's network.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure accused of repeatedly raping the victim and others as part of a sex trafficking conspiracy.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Accused of recruiting, grooming, and intimidating victims for Epstein's sex trafficking ring.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: One of the victim's former lawyers whom she accuses of betrayal, conflict of interest, and failing to represent her properly.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: One of the victim's former lawyers (referred to as 'M' or 'MIE') accused of similar misconduct as Pottinger.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Allegedly gave the victim and others a disk of photos from the island; connected to Epstein's modeling recruitment.

persons.name: Sergey Brin
persons.role: Co-Founder of Google, visitor to Epstein's island
persons.context: Described as a long-time friend of Epstein and Maxwell; visited the island with his then-fiancé.

persons.name: Ann Wojcicki
persons.role: Co-Founder of 23andMe, visitor to Epstein's island
persons.context: Visited Epstein's island with Sergey Brin; mentioned as corroborating the victim's story.

persons.name: Cathy Alexander
persons.context: Appears in the background of a photo from the island.

persons.name: Igor
persons.context: A bodyguard who confirmed to the victim's lawyers that she tried to swim off the island after being raped.

persons.name: Karyna Shuliak
persons.context: Reportedly the last person Epstein called from prison before his death; married to someone connected to visa schemes.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a separate case; the victim expresses fear of being served by him.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Mentioned by the victim in relation to a smear campaign against Prince Andrew; the victim's lawyers deny affiliation.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Mentioned as Gloria Allred's daughter; victim's lawyers deny affiliation.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a target of a smear campaign by Gloria Allred.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Described by the victim as a co-conspirator of Epstein's; Epstein allegedly bragged about their friendship to gain credibility.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Epstein bragged about being friends with to gain the victim's trust.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of media coverage creating momentum for victims to come forward; potential connection to Epstein explored by the lawyers.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned as a close friend and colleague of Epstein's, connected to Victoria's Secret.

persons.name: Kevin Spacey
persons.context: Mentioned as being present with Epstein, Maxwell, Bill Clinton, and Chris Tucker during a trip to Africa where another survivor was trafficked.

persons.name: Chris Tucker
persons.context: Mentioned as being present with Epstein, Maxwell, Bill Clinton, and Kevin Spacey during a trip to Africa.

persons.name: Judge Burman
persons.context: Judge who invited survivors to give victim impact statements after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Valdson
persons.context: Named as a travel companion on a flight to St. Thomas in December 2006.

connections.description: Described as partners in a sex trafficking conspiracy, with Maxwell recruiting and grooming victims for Epstein.
Attorneys from the same firm who jointly represented the victim and are accused of misconduct.
Pottinger was the victim's attorney from approximately January 2017 until a falling out in 2020, accused of betraying her.
McCawley was the victim's attorney, accused of ghosting her, creating conflicts of interest, and failing to protect her.
Brunel gave victims photos from the island and ran a modeling agency allegedly financed by Epstein.
Described as long-time friends; Brin and his fiancé visited Epstein's island.
Epstein allegedly bragged about a close friendship with Clinton to gain credibility with victims.
The victim accuses Pottinger of having a close personal friendship with Clinton, creating a conflict of interest.
Shuliak is described as a long-time employee of Epstein who profited from the conspiracy and helped pacify victims.

events.title: Flight to Epstein's Island
events.description: The victim flew from Newark to St. Thomas with companions named 'Valdson' and another girl, to stay on Epstein's island.

events.title: Initial Contact with Attorneys
events.description: The victim emailed attorneys Stan Pottinger and Sigrid McCawley seeking representation.

events.title: Attorneys Warn of 'Other Side'
events.description: Attorney Stan Pottinger emails the victim, warning her not to talk to the 'other side' (Epstein/Maxwell's team) if they contact her.

events.title: Victim Feels Betrayed by Attorneys
events.description: The victim emails her attorneys accusing them of leaving her 'high and dry' after getting what they wanted from her.

events.title: Contact with Fellow Survivor
events.description: The victim reconnects via email with another rape victim she was on the island with, facilitated by the attorneys.

events.title: Discussion of Weinstein-Epstein Connection
events.description: The victim and her attorneys discuss using the Harvey Weinstein media coverage to advance her case and explore a potential connection between Weinstein and Epstein.

events.title: Permission for Bar Proceeding
events.description: Stan Pottinger pressures the victim to grant permission to use her 'information' in Florida and D.C. bar proceedings against Alan Dershowitz, which she feels is unrelated to her case.

events.title: Victim Impact Statements After Epstein's Death
events.description: Survivors, including the victim, were invited by Judge Burman to address the court and give victim impact statements following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Discovery of Recruiter's Whereabouts
events.description: The victim is shocked to learn that a woman who recruited her into Epstein's ring has been found living in Colorado, despite her lawyers previously claiming they couldn't locate her.

events.title: Notification of Impending Betrayal
events.description: The victim learns from another survivor/client that her attorneys are about to betray her by potentially involving her in another case against her will.

locations: Epstein's private island (likely Little St. James)
Africa (mentioned in context of a trip with Clinton, Epstein, etc.)
keyFacts: The victim accuses her former attorneys, Stan Pottinger and Sigrid McCawley, of serious ethical breaches, including conflicts of interest, betraying her trust, failing to protect her, and prioritizing other clients' interests over hers.
She describes being repeatedly raped by Jeffrey Epstein on his private island, with Ghislaine Maxwell involved in recruitment and intimidation.

The document alleges the law firm failed to subpoena key witnesses (like fellow victims and Epstein's bodyguard Igor) who could have corroborated her story, and later represented some of those witnesses as clients.

The victim claims her lawyers discouraged her from going to the FBI, telling her "under no circumstances to go to the FBI because all my evidence would disappear," which she views as obstruction of justice.
She asserts that Jeffrey Epstein bragged about close friendships with Bill Clinton and Donald Trump to gain credibility with her, and she considers Bill Clinton a co-conspirator.
